instructions: Tap the address bar . Tap the Microphone icon, then say the URL of the website or say a search phrase. The words you spoke appear in the address bar and you have the option to go to a website or view search suggestions.

Open the main menu, then go to Settings > General > Home . In the Panels section, you can change the order of the Top Sites, Bookmarks, and History panels. Just tap the panel name and tap Change order . To change the content that appears in your Top Sites, tap Top Sites and choose the content you want.
Tap the Tab icon. A new page opens with thumbnail versions of each page. To view one of these pages, tap it. To return to the browser window, tap the Back button.
Tap Settings from the main menu. In the Settings page, tap Privacy . From here you can tell Firefox to not track your browsing behavior and to clear your private data when you close the browser.
Create a Firefox account and then sign into your Firefox account with all your devices. Tap Settings from the main menu. From the General tab, tap Sign in .

Tap Settings from the main menu. Tap Privacy . Tap Use master password . In the Create Master Password dialog, enter and confirm your password, then tap OK . When you want to use one of your stored passwords, Firefox will prompt you to enter your master password. And, when you close Firefox, your private data is locked up.

Tap Tools from the main menu, then tap New Guest Session . Firefox needs to restart before the guest session can begin. Tap Continue to start the guest session. Now you can safely hand over your phone or tablet. To cancel a guest session, tap Tools , then tap Exit Guest Session .
